meanings.definition: To remove material that is considered improper or offensive from a text.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was bowdlerizing the novel before assigning it to the students.
meanings.sent2: The editor was bowdlerizing the article to make it suitable for all readers.
meanings.sent3: The librarian joked that she was bowdlerizing the fairy tale to protect the innocence of the children.
meanings.sent4: The artist felt like bowdlerizing his painting to avoid controversy.
meanings.sent5: The author spent hours bowdlerizing the manuscript to comply with the publishing guidelines.

meanings.definition: To censor or edit a work by removing or altering content deemed inappropriate.
meanings.sent1: The government was bowdlerizing the film to control the information shared with the public.
meanings.sent2: The TV network was bowdlerizing the show to meet broadcasting standards.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about bowdlerizing his jokes to avoid offending anyone.
meanings.sent4: The journalist accused the editor of bowdlerizing the news to fit a certain agenda.
meanings.sent5: The author refused to allow anyone to bowdlerize her novel, standing by her artistic vision.

meanings.definition: The act of sanitizing or expurgating a text to make it more suitable for a particular audience.
meanings.sent1: The bowdlerizing of the book made it appropriate for young readers.
meanings.sent2: The publisher's bowdlerizing of the magazine ensured it was family-friendly.
meanings.sent3: The committee's bowdlerizing of the report made it easier to understand for the public.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's bowdlerizing of the play was necessary for the school production.
meanings.sent5: The company's bowdlerizing of the website aimed to appeal to a wider audience.
